info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued May 22 at 5:22PM EDT until May 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, around 1 foot of inundation above ground level in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected.
* WHERE...Southern Queens County.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 7 PM EDT this evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, from Friday morning through Friday evening.
* COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Minor flooding in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect around 1 foot of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding.
* RIP CURRENT IMPACTS...Life-threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING
